data.title: Campus Partner Universities
data.text:
The Campus-in-Campus (CiC) Initiative is a scheme of sharing campuses among the partner universities with a purpose of utilizing our respective research and educational resources without any national or institutional barriers. Moreover, through the CiC scheme, partner universities are highly expected to enhance the mobility of exchange students, faculty members and administrative staff. As of October 2023, we have concluded CiC agreements with Al-Farabi Kazakh National University, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, National Cheng Kung University, National Taiwan University, Ohio State University, Ruhr University Bochum, Univ. Grenoble Alpes, Universiti Teknologi Malaysia, University of Bordeaux, University of California Irvine, University of Sao Paulo, and Utrecht University (12 universities in total). By the end of AY2023, we plan to establish CiC in 13 of our overseas partners.

Latest News

・ National Cheng Kung University (Taiwan) and Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati (India) have joined as new CiC partner universities (September, 2023).
